alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 7:06PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Weld and southeastern Larimer Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 705 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Teds Place to 4 miles east of Cedar Cove, or along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Fort Collins to 22 miles west of Greeley. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Collins, Greeley, Loveland, Windsor, Evans, Johnstown, Wellington, Milliken, Berthoud, Eaton, Severance, LaSalle, Ault, Gilcrest, Timnath, Masonville, Teds Place and Bellvue. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County
